play['Type'] = play['Type'].fillna('Free')
play['Content Rating'] = play["Content Rating"].fillna('Everyone')
source.1f59e4ab: play = play.drop(labels = "Genres	Last Updated	Current Ver	Android Ver".split('\t'),axis = 1)
source.beb63f1c: play['Price'] = play['Price'].apply(lambda x : float(x.replace('$','')) if x != 'Everyone' else 0)
source.db8e4df7: play['Size'] = play['Size'].apply(lambda x : '0' if x == 'Varies with device' else x)
source.030ec6d2: play['Size'] = play['Size'].apply(lambda x : float(x.replace('k',''))/1000 if 'k' in x else float(x))

Assuming Content Rating for null value to be Everyone

source.9d9df1c7:
Android has been the best-selling OS worldwide on smartphones since 2011 and on tablets since 2013. As of May 2017, it has over two billion monthly active users, the largest installed base of any operating system, and as of August 2020, the Google Play Store features over 3 million apps


The provided Datasets contains Data about Android Apps available in India


[Dataset Link](https://www.kaggle.com/lava18/google-play-store-apps)


Thanks to [@lavanyagupta](https://www.kaggle.com/lava18) for providing the Dataset
source.f3b0f067: Finance, Lifestyle, Events, Family and Medical Apps are costly while others are either free or have low price
